refactoring

Module contents

This module aims at fixing dashboards and cards when your data warehouse structure (schema, table or column) has changed.

Submodules

refactoring.reference_system module

refactoring.reference_system.renaming_card_column(conn, old_column_name: str, new_column_name: str, table_name: str, schema_name: str)[source]

Renaming column in the ref system of Metabase, and thus is updating all the custom questions using this column

Parameters:

  • conn (psycopg2 DBAPI2 connector) – Connexion to your Metabase Database

  • old_column_name (str) – Former name of the column

  • new_column_name (str) – New name of the column

  • table_name (str) – Table name that contains this column

  • schema_name (str) – Schema name that contains the column table

Return type:

Nothing as it has been build to change the Metabase DB synchronously.

refactoring.reference_system.renaming_card_schema(conn, old_schema_name, new_schema_name)[source]

Renaming schema in the ref system of Metabase

Parameters:

  • conn (psycopg2 DBAPI2 connector) – Connexion to your Metabase Database

  • old_schema_name (str) – Former name of the schema

  • new_schema_name (str) – New name of the schema

Return type:

Nothing as it has been build to change the Metabase DB synchronously.

refactoring.reference_system.renaming_card_table(conn, old_table_name: str, new_table_name: str, new_display_table_name: str, schema_name: str)[source]

Renaming table in the ref system of Metabase, and thus is updating all the custom questions using this table

Parameters:

  • conn (psycopg2 DBAPI2 connector) – Connexion to your Metabase Database

  • old_table_name (str) – Former name of the table

  • new_table_name (str) – New name of the table

  • new_display_table_name (str) – New name of the displayed table. Should follow the standard : table_name has a displayed name “Table Name”

  • schema_name (str) – Schema name that contains the column table

Return type:

Nothing as it has been build to change the Metabase DB synchronously.

refactoring.sql_query module

refactoring.sql_query.renaming_sql_query_column(conn, old_column_name: str, new_column_name: str, table_name: str, schema_name: str)[source]

Renaming a column in all the sql query created. WARNING : could have side effect, depending on SQL standard used across all your Metabase.

Parameters:

  • conn (psycopg2 DBAPI2 connector) – Connexion to your Metabase Database

  • old_column_name (str) – Former name of the column

  • new_column_name (str) – New name of the column

  • table_name (str) – Table name that contains this column

  • schema_name (str) – Schema name that contains the column table

Return type:

Nothing as it has been build to change the Metabase DB synchronously.
